CatDescriptText: Mrs. Ollie Huff, 2147 Rose Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 3, 1958, pg. 1A with question: "Do you think that the average family spends too much time watching television programs? If so, how has it affected family life?" answer reads: "I really can't say because I do not have a television set.  However, quite a few people do spend too much time watching television.  It's all right to watch TV if you have nothing else to do, but if you have something to do, it's bad."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. Ollie Huff, wearing eyeglasses, drop earrings, patterned blouse, and bracelet, holding handbag on left arm, standing in front of block wall with man on left and display that reads "...flam Windproof Lighter... Itself... Anytime... Everytime... 3.95" in store window on right
